common_issues.title: Pieces OS LTM and File Recognition Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Pieces OS recognizing files and folders, and with the Long Term Memory (LTM) feature. This includes difficulties accessing file content, enabling LTM, and inconsistent behavior across different operating systems. Proposed solutions involve software updates, bug fixes, and improved user education on LTM usage.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS 11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So until about a weekish ago, Everything would work smoothly, except for some other issues that did annoy me, but I had workarounds for them. Those issues was pieces os not working after a while. Not a big deal since I would just close it in task manager and reopen it once it was all closed to force a hard restart of the whole system. But, now (thanks for listening to my little rant up there) there is an issue that I cannot workaround. For some reason pieces cannot get any context from any files or folders, and its getting pretty annoying to the fact that I have started using other softwares because at least they can look at the files and suggest changes or edits that actually have something to do with my code. I believe this happened ever since i updated pieces os about 2-3 updates ago, but cannot pinpoint any specific cause. Another cause may be that fact that I downloaded Ollama but never really used it.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User RamanBaig reported an issue where the model can recognize files and their names but cannot read their content.
* This issue persists even with Long Term Memory enabled and across different foundation models.
* The issue affects all folders and files, including those with thousands of lines of code.
* User is running Windows 11 Home, 24H2 and has approximately 9 files in the folder, with only 4 actively used.
* The issue has been difficult to reproduce for the developers.

**Problems Identified:**

* Model cannot read content of files despite recognizing them.
* Issue persists across different models and settings.
* Issue affects all folders and files, regardless of size.
* Difficulty in reproducing the issue for developers.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Developers are requesting additional information and may schedule a call to investigate further.
* Developers have made changes that may resolve the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* Developers are working on a potential fix.

**Additional Information:**

* The user is using Windows 11 Home, 24H2.
* The user has approximately 9 files in the folder, with only 4 actively used.
* The issue affects files with thousands of lines of code.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[https://disk.yandex.ru/i/Z_U0FzYA8NBrNg](url)

##  Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User reported LTM Engine not enabling and encountering problems after updating.
* Logs show one of the dependencies for the LTM Engine failing to boot.
* User shared size of their qdrant_db directory.

**Problems identified:**

* LTM Engine not enabling.
* Browser page opening after each reboot.
* Qdrant failing to boot.
* High idle time expense.

* Qdrant booting issue under investigation.
* New database infrastructure coming soon.
* User found workaround by reinstalling Pieces and restoring settings from backup.
* PyCharm plugin issue remains unaddressed.

**Additional notes:**

* User reports using Yandex Translate resulting in communication challenges.
* User attached image of high idle time expense.

## Overall
The issue of the LTM Engine not enabling seems to be partially resolved with the update. However, the user’s dependency issue needs further investigation. The team is working on resolving the Qdrant booting issue and is developing a new database infrastructure that should address this problem.

related_issues.title: Obsidian Plugin
related_issues.text:
Obsidian Plugin
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi! I'm attempting to get the Pieces for Devs Obsidian plugin to work. The installation of the Pieces for Devs " Pieces for Obsidian plugin" goes seemingly faultless as it reports in green: " Pieces for Obsidian plugin installed successfully". 

 However, as soon as I attempt to enable the plugin (v1.21.1)the following error pops up ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”. 
- Obsidian v1.7.7 is up to date, and running. 
- Pieces OS v11.0.3 is running, and 
- Pieces for Devs Desktop is up and running @ v3.3.3. 
- The OS is Windows 10 Pro 64 bit Version 22H2, Build 19045.5247 updated 02-02-2025

I have followed the guidelines in the following documentation (https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian). The install fails with a not-very-helpful answer. ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”

Referring to the section "https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian#having-trouble-with-the-pieces-for-developers-obsidian-plugin" in the documentation still fails to provide the expected results, so the next step would be to attempt to find related installation logs that might shed light on the issue.

I've searched for possible issues indicating this type of bug/issue but none were found here on GitHub.
I had a look at the `obsidian.log` file in the `C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\obsidian` folder but there's no indication at all nor any mention of any plugins or installations related to such.

Repeat uninstall/reinstall advice does not resolve the problem either.
Could you indicate which other Pieces, Obsidian and Win-OS logs would be the most appropriate to investigate which might shed light on the cause, please?

**Edit:**
I'm using other plugins without any issues.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19b3dcd2-05fa-4171-ae2e-dc71b5ce451c)

Thank you for looking into this.

**Problems Identified:**

* Andre-ADPC was able to share the console information after receiving further clarification.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation ended with Andre-ADPC providing the requested information.
* It is unclear if the issue was resolved, as the conversation did not progress further.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation was respectful and helpful.
* bishoy-at-pieces was patient and provided clear instructions.

Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins

macOS/Windows/Linux

11.0.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We introduce one of the largest releases in the Pieces Ecosystem.

Lots of bug fixes - targeting some of the largest hitches in the user journey to name a few: rate limiting(authenticate to bypass, + better error messaging), entirely new Ollama (local LLM) infrastructure w/ in the copilot, and tackling installation head-on.

The detailed list of changes is not quite ready yet; however, it will be here shortly. (I will post them here when they are)

However, this issue is here let you know to update all your plugins and provide the status of all of the new plugins(in the case they are not yet out in production)

Pieces For Developers(Desktop Application): 3.3.0 - Live
PiecesOs: 11.0.0 - Live
vscode: 2.0.0 - Live
JetBrains: 11.0.0 - Live
Visual Studio: 4.0.0 - Live
Jupyter: 1.21.0 - Live
Obsidian: 1.21.0 - Live
Sublime: 1.5.0 - Live
CLI: - 1.9.0 Live
NeoVim: - 1.3.0 Live
Chrome(web) Extension: - 4.0.0 (This is under review)

Please, if you have any questions about the release or are having trouble updating to the latest, comment in this thread, and we can help you out!!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User reported browser extension blinking and popup URL appearing on startup.
* Another user reported outdated plugin information for Jetbrains plugin.
* A third user reported being prompted to update non-existent plugins.

**Problems Identified:**

* Browser extension malfunctioning with constant blinking.
* Annoying popup URL appearing on startup.
* Outdated plugin information for Jetbrains plugin.
* Prompting to update non-existent plugins.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User advised to update extensions to remove the popup URL.
* Update planned for PiecesOS to remove the popup.
* Request for additional information to troubleshoot browser extension blinking.
* User advised to provide screenshots for further troubleshooting.
* User suggested a more robust cleanup mechanism for plugins.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Popup URL issue is planned to be fixed in the next PiecesOS update.
* Browser extension blinking issue requires further investigation.
* Jetbrains plugin version information issue requires further investigation.
* Plugin prompting issue requires further investigation and potential cleanup mechanism improvement.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation is ongoing as of January 6, 2025.
* Some issues haven't been fully resolved and require further investigation.
* Users are encouraged to provide additional information to help troubleshoot the problems.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues from Remote Environments
common_issues.description: Users experience difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from VS Code remote environments and encounter console errors due to port scanning. Solutions include a plugin update addressing listening interfaces and potential fixes for console cluttering. Updating to the latest Pieces OS version (11.0.3) is recommended.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points Raised:** * User @malanciault encountered an error message when trying to access Pieces OS from a VS Code DevContainer. * The error persisted even without a VS Code project opened and after removing the Custom URL. * The problem was identified as a change in the Pieces OS default listening interface for security purposes, which prevented access from the remote DevContainer. **Problems Identified:** * Difficulty connecting from DevContainer due to changes in the Pieces OS default listening interface. * Webview tool window could not resolve the `host.docker.internal` address used for connection. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Patch to the VS Code plugin to enable listening on all interfaces (currently under development). * Workaround involving creating a custom DNS name and modifying `/etc/hosts` entries (complex). **Current Status/Outcome:** * Patch (version 2.0.1 of the VS Code extension) has been released. After updating, the issue should be resolved and users should be able to remove the Custom URL. * User @malanciault experienced continued issues after the update, prompting further investigation through a video call. **Additional Notes:** * The user is encouraged to try the new plugin version and report any remaining issues. * The conversation indicates ongoing work on the patch to address potential problems.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## Conversation Summary: Pieces OS Port Errors in Dev Console **Problem:** Lorenwest reported seeing repeated "failed calls" related to Pieces OS in their development console. This cluttered the console and caused inconvenience. **Key Points:** - The errors arose from recent Pieces OS updates which removed a designated port for the software. - This led to Pieces OS checking for its API across various ports, causing the errors. - Rutvik110 initially assured that privacy was not compromised as the checks targeted only Pieces OS endpoints. - Lorenwest clarified that the main concern was the cluttering of the console, impacting their debugging workflow. - Rutvik acknowledged the issue and promised a fix in the upcoming patch update. **Solutions:** - Rutvik initially aimed to suppress the error messages within the extension. - Further investigation revealed the issue's origin in Chrome and its handling of extension network requests. - A temporary solution suggested hiding network messages in the dev console settings. **Current Status:** - The Chrome bug mentioned by Rutvik hasn't been officially addressed or fixed yet. - However, the team is likely looking for alternative solutions to handle the console cluttering or has opted for the temporary setting change suggestion. **Outcome:** - Lorenwest was informed about the root cause and potential solutions. - It remains unclear whether a permanent fix within Pieces OS or Chrome has been implemented. **Additional Notes:** - The Chrome bug issue IDs provided can be used to track for further updates. - The conversation highlights the importance of clear communication and addressing user concerns about software behavior.

common_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Issues on Linux
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature on Linux, including unavailability, activation errors, and limited functionality. The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues, working on solutions like infrastructure improvements and dependency updates. Users are encouraged to provide logs and system information for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine is in a testing phase for Linux, working on X11 but not Wayland.
* There is confusion regarding LTM availability and functionality.
* Users are experiencing issues with LTM not turning on, even on X11.
* Sharing log files is essential for troubleshooting.

**Problems identified:**

* LTM compatibility with Wayland.
* Lack of clarity regarding feature limitations and troubleshooting.
* Dependency issues preventing LTM activation on some machines.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Switching to X11 (temporary workaround).
* Requesting user logs to investigate root cause.
* Scheduling live troubleshooting sessions.
* Sharing updates and troubleshooting progress through additional GH issues.
* Deprecation of dependency causing bootup issues.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The LTM Engine is in an ongoing testing phase and still experiences issues with specific Linux configurations.
* Developers are actively investigating and troubleshooting issues with LTM functionality.
* Affected users are encouraged to provide detailed reports and collaborate on resolving their individual cases.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation focuses on a specific user's issue but acknowledges a similar problem reported by another user ("scotch86").
* It is recommended to refer to both GH issues mentioned in the conversation for a more complete picture of the situation (Issue #553 and this issue).

**Overall:** While LTM shows promise for Linux users, its current state requires further development and testing. Collaborative troubleshooting efforts and user feedback are crucial to resolving remaining issues.

* User experience was impacted due to limited functionality.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a bug on their side and stated it would be resolved in version 11.0.3.
* The solution involved improving LTM functionality and user education.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was acknowledged and addressed in version 11.0.3.
* Mark-at-pieces suggested improved user education on prompting LTM effectively.
* Scotch86 remains available for further communication if issues persist. 

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of user feedback and communication for identifying and resolving software issues. 
* The solution demonstrates an iterative approach to improving functionality and user experience.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine is in a testing phase for Linux, working on X11 but not Wayland.
* There is confusion regarding LTM availability and functionality.
* Users are experiencing issues with LTM not turning on, even on X11.
* Sharing log files is essential for troubleshooting.

**Problems identified:**

* LTM compatibility with Wayland.
* Lack of clarity regarding feature limitations and troubleshooting.
* Dependency issues preventing LTM activation on some machines.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Switching to X11 (temporary workaround).
* Requesting user logs to investigate root cause.
* Scheduling live troubleshooting sessions.
* Sharing updates and troubleshooting progress through additional GH issues.
* Deprecation of dependency causing bootup issues.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The LTM Engine is in an ongoing testing phase and still experiences issues with specific Linux configurations.
* Developers are actively investigating and troubleshooting issues with LTM functionality.
* Affected users are encouraged to provide detailed reports and collaborate on resolving their individual cases.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation focuses on a specific user's issue but acknowledges a similar problem reported by another user ("scotch86").
* It is recommended to refer to both GH issues mentioned in the conversation for a more complete picture of the situation (Issue #553 and this issue).

**Overall:** While LTM shows promise for Linux users, its current state requires further development and testing. Collaborative troubleshooting efforts and user feedback are crucial to resolving remaining issues.

related_issues.text:
Obsidian Plugin
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi! I'm attempting to get the Pieces for Devs Obsidian plugin to work. The installation of the Pieces for Devs " Pieces for Obsidian plugin" goes seemingly faultless as it reports in green: " Pieces for Obsidian plugin installed successfully". 

 However, as soon as I attempt to enable the plugin (v1.21.1)the following error pops up ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”. 
- Obsidian v1.7.7 is up to date, and running. 
- Pieces OS v11.0.3 is running, and 
- Pieces for Devs Desktop is up and running @ v3.3.3. 
- The OS is Windows 10 Pro 64 bit Version 22H2, Build 19045.5247 updated 02-02-2025

I have followed the guidelines in the following documentation (https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian). The install fails with a not-very-helpful answer. ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”

Referring to the section "https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian#having-trouble-with-the-pieces-for-developers-obsidian-plugin" in the documentation still fails to provide the expected results, so the next step would be to attempt to find related installation logs that might shed light on the issue.

I've searched for possible issues indicating this type of bug/issue but none were found here on GitHub.
I had a look at the `obsidian.log` file in the `C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\obsidian` folder but there's no indication at all nor any mention of any plugins or installations related to such.

Repeat uninstall/reinstall advice does not resolve the problem either.
Could you indicate which other Pieces, Obsidian and Win-OS logs would be the most appropriate to investigate which might shed light on the cause, please?

**Edit:**
I'm using other plugins without any issues.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19b3dcd2-05fa-4171-ae2e-dc71b5ce451c)

Thank you for looking into this.
